item.title: A Million Reasons
item.description:
A Million Reasons

There were a million reasons why I loved her, but I couldn't say one, just one. They say true love has no reasons, and the love that we had, it was like no other. My friend Minnie, she used to say from the bottom of her heart, "I like the way you love her."

item.title: Letters To Rachael
item.description:
Letters To Rachael

Letters to RachaelDear Rachael, They say love is blind, but I think it's just deep-sighted. It makes you close your eyes and see with your mind. And that's how you do me, Stranger; you make me see with my mind. Sometimes I see us, you and I, and we have neither past nor present, no...

item.title: Scars.
item.description:
Scars.

I. My fascination with healed wounds began as a little boy, through those endless primary school days, when after each football game and after each attempt to dive at the ball in style like I often saw on my neighbor's black and white TV with the twin doors, I'd come home with at least four...

item.title: This Day These Days
item.description:
This Day These Days

This day these days are quiet days, I feel a peace that belies the war Between uncertainty and optimism. And the days wave when they go by But they never wait for me. A million thoughts to dream, The defeated past beneath my feet, Time frozen in time, within time, I keep finding my tested...
